title: Propulsion Assignment
description: Investigate propulsion systems by exploring the principles of thrust and different propulsion mechanisms. Apply theoretical knowledge to analyze real-world applications and design a simplified propulsion model.

title: Combustion Analysis
description: Examine the science of combustion, focusing on chemical reactions, flame characteristics, and energy output. Conduct experiments to evaluate combustion efficiency and emissions, understanding their impact on engine performance and environmental factors.

title: Nozzle Design Project
description: Engage in the design and optimization of nozzles for propulsion systems. Learn about nozzle geometry, flow dynamics, and performance criteria. Develop a nozzle design that maximizes efficiency and meets specified requirements.

title: Aerodynamics Quiz
description: Assess your knowledge of aerodynamics through a comprehensive quiz. Covering key concepts such as lift, drag, airfoil design, and fluid dynamics, this quiz tests your understanding of the principles governing objects in airflow.

title: Flow Analysis
description: Analyze fluid flow through various systems, studying patterns, velocities, and pressures. Use computational tools to simulate flow behavior and optimize system performance based on flow characteristics.

title: Heating Analysis
description: Explore the principles of heat transfer and thermal management. Conduct experiments and simulations to analyze heating efficiency, thermal conductivity, and temperature distribution in different materials and systems.

title: Structural Design Task
description: Engage in the design and analysis of structural components, focusing on strength, stability, and material properties. Create a structural design that meets specified load-bearing and safety criteria.

title: Orbital Calculations
description: Perform calculations related to orbital mechanics, including satellite trajectories, orbital transfers, and gravitational influences. Apply mathematical principles to predict and optimize the paths of objects in space.

title: Systems Engineering Exam
description: Test your comprehensive understanding of systems engineering principles through an exam. Covering topics such as system design, integration, project management, and lifecycle analysis, this exam evaluates your proficiency in managing complex engineering projects.
